headline.main: Foreign Exchange Rates; Week Ended May 2, 1958

docs.snippet: LA PAZ, Bolivia, May 6 -- According to Bolivia's President, an economic and political collapse that could lead to a Communist regime or "a somber dictatorship of Fascist character" may occur here unless new United States aid is received.
docs.lead_paragraph: LA PAZ, Bolivia, May 6 -- According to Bolivia's President, an economic and political collapse that could lead to a Communist regime or "a somber dictatorship of Fascist character" may occur here unless new United States aid is received.

docs.snippet: ROME, May 6 (UP) -- Mimi Arnold of Redwood City, Calif., provided the United States with its only victory today in the Rome international tennis championships.

headline.main: MISS ARNOLD WINS FIRST-ROUND TEST; Beats Maria Cerra in Rome Tennis, but Americans Drop 4 Other Matches

docs.snippet: ROME, May 7 (UP) -- Foreign tennis players eliminated Gregory Grant of Los Angeles and Wayne Van Voorhees of Palm Beach, Fla., today in the second round of men's singles in the Rome international championships.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 9 -- The student agitation against Vice President Richard M. Nixon during his South American tour is considered here to be part of a coordinated Communist campaign to hurt the United States in its hemisphere relations.

docs.snippet: The term Latin America covers the twenty republics south of the Rio Grande which embrace 8,000,000 square miles and about 170,000,000 people. Despite this large population and rich natural resources, most of the Latin-American republis are short of...
docs.lead_paragraph: The term Latin America covers the twenty republics south of the Rio Grande which embrace 8,000,000 square miles and about 170,000,000 people. Despite this large population and rich natural resources, most of the Latin-American republis are short of investment capitaI, electric power, transportation and technical personnel.

docs.snippet: QUITO, Ecuador, May 10 -In the last thirteen days, since Vice President Richard M. Nixon took to the road in South America, the scope, depth and extent of problems facing the United States in this part of the Western Hemisphere have been coming into...
docs.lead_paragraph: QUITO, Ecuador, May 10 -In the last thirteen days, since Vice President Richard M. Nixon took to the road in South America, the scope, depth and extent of problems facing the United States in this part of the Western Hemisphere have been coming into focus with clarity and sharp touches of drama.
docs.abstract: long-standing problems, resentments against US policy, effects of USSR trade lures seen factors in hostility toward Nixon during his tour; cartoons; map

docs.snippet: QUITO, Ecuador, May 10 -- Vice President Nixon said today that there was a danger that the Soviet Union might dump industrial products in key Latin American areas to disrupt the region's trade pattern.
docs.lead_paragraph: QUITO, Ecuador, May 10 -- Vice President Nixon said today that there was a danger that the Soviet Union might dump industrial products in key Latin American areas to disrupt the region's trade pattern.
docs.abstract: Vice Pres Nixon, in Quito, warns USSR may try to dump indus goods in Latin Amer to disrupt trade; sees evidence of USSR inroads in 4 nations; hears many complaints on declining prices in US mkt
